meanings.definition: The saltiness or concentration of salt in a solution.
meanings.sent1: The salinity of the ocean water affects the marine life living in it.
meanings.sent2: Scientists measure the salinity of the water to understand its salt content.
meanings.sent3: The fish complained about the high salinity of their swimming pool.
meanings.sent4: The salinity of her tears matched the bitterness of her heart.
meanings.sent5: The intense salinity of the pickle made her pucker her lips.

meanings.definition: The amount of salt in a body of water.
meanings.sent1: The salinity of the lake was too high for some fish species to survive.
meanings.sent2: The sailors checked the salinity of the sea before setting sail.
meanings.sent3: The ducks enjoyed the salty salinity of the pond.
meanings.sent4: The salinity of the Dead Sea is so high that people float effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The salinity of the soup was perfect, not too salty but just right.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being salty.
meanings.sent1: The chef adjusted the salinity of the dish by adding a pinch of salt.
meanings.sent2: The salinity of the chips made them irresistible to snack on.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the salinity of the ocean making it the world's largest seasoning.
meanings.sent4: The salinity of his humor left a bitter taste in everyone's mouth.
meanings.sent5: The popcorn vendor increased the salinity of the popcorn to please salty snack lovers.
